NFL Analyst Predicts Marvin Harrison Jr. Will Break Rookie Records
By the Numbers
Marvin Harrison, Jr., the Arizona Cardinals' rookie wide receiver, is predicted to break the rookie reception and yardage records set by Puka Nacua last season. CBS Sports analyst Tyler Sullivan suggests that Harrison, as the primary receiving option and with the anticipated return of quarterback Kyler Murray, is well-positioned to achieve this. In 2020, Murray's connection with DeAndre Hopkins yielded impressive stats, which could foreshadow a record-setting season for Harrison. The Cardinals will need to rely heavily on their passing game to compete in the NFC West alongside formidable opponents. Harrison's performance will be put to the test in their upcoming game against the Buffalo Bills.
- Marvin Harrison, Jr. is projected to surpass Puka Nacua's rookie records of 105 receptions and 1,430 yards.
- Kyler Murray's past season with DeAndre Hopkins included 115 receptions and 1,407 yards.

- Kyler Murray's health and connection with Harrison will be crucial for their offensive success.
